intro: Psacalium langlassei, commonly known as the Langlasse's psacalium, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or dense undergrowth. Its botanical features include hairy stems and small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
